briefdescription.para: Cast x, a pointer, to an unsigned integer.
Cast x, an unsigned integer, to a void*.
Cast x, a pointer, to a signed integer.
Cast x, a signed integer, to a void*.

detaileddescription.para: Number of bits in a long int.

briefdescription.para: Create a contiguous bitmask starting at bit position l and ending at position h.
Extract the Least Significant Bit from value.
Extract a bitfield element from value corresponding to the field mask mask.
Prepare a bitfield element using value with mask representing its field position and width. The result should be combined with other fields using a logical OR.
0 if cond is true-ish; causes a compile error otherwise.
Zero if array has an array type, a compile error otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This macro is available only from C, not C++.

briefdescription.para: Number of elements in the given array.

detaileddescription.para: In C++, due to language limitations, this will accept as array any type that implements operator[]. The results may not be particulary meaningful in this case.
In C, passing a pointer as array causes a compile error.

briefdescription.para: Check if a pointer ptr lies within array.

detaileddescription.para: In C but not C++, this causes a compile error if array is not an array (e.g. if ptr and array are mixed up).

parameterdescription.para: a pointer
an array

simplesect.para: 1 if ptr is part of array, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer to a structure containing the element.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to a structure element
name of the type that ptr is an element of
the name of the field within the struct ptr points to

simplesect.para: a pointer to the structure that contains ptr

briefdescription.para: Value of x rounded up to the next multiple of align, which must be a power of 2.
Value of x rounded down to the previous multiple of align, which must be a power of 2.
Value of x rounded up to the next word boundary.
Value of x rounded down to the previous word boundary.
Ceiling function applied to numerator / divider as a fraction.
The larger value between a and b.
The smaller value between a and b.
Clamp a value to a given range.
Number of bytes in x kibibytes.
Number of bytes in x mebibytes.
Number of bytes in x gibibytes.
Number of Hz in x kHz.
Number of Hz in x MHz.
Is x a power of two?

parameterdescription.para: value to check

simplesect.para: true if x is a power of two, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Arithmetic shift right.

parameterdescription.para: value to shift
number of bits to shift

simplesect.para: value shifted right by shift; opened bit positions are filled with the sign bit

briefdescription.para: byte by byte memcpy.

detaileddescription.para: Copy size bytes of src into dest. This is guaranteed to be done byte by byte.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the destination memory.
Pointer to the source of the data.
The number of bytes to copy.

briefdescription.para: byte by byte swap.

detaileddescription.para: Swap size bytes between memory regions a and b. This is guaranteed to be done byte by byte.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the the first memory region.
Pointer to the the second memory region.
The number of bytes to swap.

briefdescription.para: Convert a single character into a hexadecimal nibble.

parameterdescription.para: The character to convert
The address of storage for the converted number.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Convert a single hexadecimal nibble into a character.

parameterdescription.para: The number to convert
The address of storage for the converted character.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *buf, size_t buflen, char *hex, size_t hexlen)
memberdef.name: bin2hex

briefdescription.para: Convert a binary array into string representation.

parameterdescription.para: The binary array to convert
The length of the binary array to convert
Address of where to store the string representation.
Size of the storage area for string representation.

simplesect.para: The length of the converted string, or 0 if an error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *hex, size_t hexlen, uint8_t *buf, size_t buflen)
memberdef.name: hex2bin

briefdescription.para: Convert a hexadecimal string into a binary array.

parameterdescription.para: The hexadecimal string to convert
The length of the hexadecimal string to convert.
Address of where to store the binary data
Size of the storage area for binary data

simplesect.para: The length of the binary array, or 0 if an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Convert a binary coded decimal (BCD 8421) value to binary.

parameterdescription.para: BCD 8421 value to convert.

briefdescription.para: Convert a binary value to binary coded decimal (BCD 8421).

parameterdescription.para: Binary value to convert.

briefdescription.para: Convert a uint8_t into a decimal string representation.

detaileddescription.para: Convert a uint8_t value into its ASCII decimal string representation. The string is terminated if there is enough space in buf.

parameterdescription.para: Address of where to store the string representation.
Size of the storage area for string representation.
The value to convert to decimal string

simplesect.para: The length of the converted string (excluding terminator if any), or 0 if an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Properly truncate a NULL-terminated UTF-8 string.

detaileddescription.para: Take a NULL-terminated UTF-8 string and ensure that if the string has been truncated (by setting the NULL terminator) earlier by other means, that the string ends with a properly formatted UTF-8 character (1-4 bytes).

parameterdescription.para: NULL-terminated string

briefdescription.para: Copies a UTF-8 encoded string from src to dst.

detaileddescription.para: The resulting dst will always be NULL terminated, and the dst string will always be properly UTF-8 truncated.

dst
The destination of the UTF-8 string.
src
The source string
n
The size of the dst buffer. Shall not be 0.
return Pointer to the dst

briefdescription.para: Misc utilities.

detaileddescription.para: Misc utilities usable by the kernel and application code.
